comments.commentBody:
There are many reasons to convert a single image to a pdf before transmitting it. (Of course, if you're trying to combine multiple images into a single page, pdf will be the only natural choice.)

I email a lot of images and almost always burn pdfs. The resolution you select will not be tampered with, and it will look the same on any device its displayed or printed on. A bitmap format like jpg will render differently on devices with different natural resolutions.

Many professional printers use pdf internally and produce optimal, predictable results when fed pdf.

Of course pdf supports documents of arbitrary complexity, but using pdf for a single image is common and certainly a best practice.

This notion that this clue, which has appeared in many crosswords from many publishers, is incorrect is not right. Sorry.

That Mark Bittman of all people -- he of the "The Minimalist" and several fine cookbooks -- would go in for this is shocking at the very least. It was Bittman who hectored people to learn to cook at home! and eat healthier.

You won't ever learn that if you are led by the hand, and get meals that are pre-packed and pre-designed and require no thought.

Shopping and planning are just as integral skills for eating (and for LIFE) as the actual job of cooking food in a pan over the stove.

Shipping people basic ingredients, at triple or quadruple the store cost -- and packed in miles of cardboard, boxes, shrink wrap, plastic, foam, etc. -- just cannot make sense if you have the slightest concern for the environment. It is just unbelievably wasteful and expensive.

Concerned Citizen - I fully agree on your point about the environment, but when you say this:
"You won't ever learn that if you are led by the hand, and get meals that are pre-packed and pre-designed and require no thought."
do you think about people who don't know how to cook? When my mother started teaching me, she did not say: boil that pasta until done and fry the meat with appropriate seasoning added, she showed me the step-by-step process. Also the basic cookbook her mother got her when she started cooking for herself.

Once you know what the basics mean, you can use your imagination. Unitl then, learning necessitates some no thinking required reading of recipes.

While there is clearly a value and a niche at the moment for these services, the sad aspect of their utility is that they push yet another aspect of how we structure and control our lives from one which is relational to one which is transactional. Instead of (as Bittman notes) thinking about, and engaging with, the food we eat, instead we have paid someone else to take that trouble.

I don't begrudge those who find this a relief to the challenge of cooking 7 nights a week, nor those who simply need some adjunct to help them build confidence in the kitchen; but let's not lose sight of the fact that this is a privileged means to a pampered end, and one which strips us of an integral aspect of how we relate to what we eat.
I doubt it. Doing so would have egregiously been legislating from the bench, of which he was no fan.

What a load some commenters are leaving. Non-citizens have absolutely no right to representation. Zero Zip Nada. Thus the hue and cry or Republicans is entirely misplaced. We only demand that those that do vote are properly identified, a reasonable request given the large 'undocumented' population, and that non-citizens surely should not be counted for representation, regardless of whether they are included in the census. Let's not excuse on problem with another. The result of leftist policies is the destruction of the country.
One has to wonder if reporters actually read Justice Ginsberg's opinion. Along with merely allowing States to do what they already do, she may have also permitted the sun to keep rising in the east.

This reader remains baffled. The Court's ruling now allows states to count all residents for apportionment, so Democratically controlled states will and cannot be challenged for doing so. But since the Court is not requiring states to count all residents, Republican states such as Texas and Arizona will not, to exclude representation to residents without voting rights.

How can this be a victory for Democrats, except that they can continue to do what they have been doing and so can Republicans.

The issue of whether the states could use eligible voters as a standard was not properly before the court. The court cannot in general rule on issues that have not been brought before it, so the resolution of that question will have to wait.
This may be the best summation of the current GOP candidates that I have seen the entire election cycle. We are definitely bound in darkness.
Hey and Bernie is Dumbledore...or Gandalf to keep the hobbit themed image.

We have a sitting governor with an abhorrent record, a guy who's never been elected to anything but owns a lot of real estate and has a big tower, and a guy who's been elected but has stabbed all his colleagues in the back. In other words, our choices are Denethor, Sauron and Saruman. We gotta melt that ring, and fast
Kasich is no moderate. He just seems sane in comparison...

Re: "What does it say that the only GOP candidate that can beat either DNC candidate is considered too moderate?"

Sanders polls about Kasich. Kasich couldn't beat him.

What does it say that the only GOP candidate that can beat either DNC candidate is considered too moderate?

This is not the party of Reagan.

And to the Republic for which it stands....
What arrogance. I want Kasich to stay in. I hope he does.

Silly Republicans aren't good at math.  The only chance of derailing Trump from getting the nomination is to keep him below the threshold to win the first ballot.  With Kasich in the race, this is more likely to happen. Cruz should be happy he is staying.
Whether or not Trump wins on his home turf, it's not because New Yorkers like or want him;  it's because they really really don't want Cruz or Kasich.
It is also mathematically impossible to Cruz to even get near the magic 1237. Nor does he possess any plausible chance of catching Trump on his home turf of the future primaries in new England.

I'm always amused when politicians get upset that other politicians are playing politics.  What the heck?  Of course Kasich won't withdraw.  If he's got enough delegates to prevent Trump or Cruz from getting a first ballot win, then he's got some power at the convention.  What pol would give that up?

The Republican primary race, now down to Cruz, Trump, and Kasich (sort of) has all the elements of a great film noir or, funny enough, a creepy slasher flick.
I would like Alfred Hitchcock or, perhaps, Orson Welles to direct the ending. The cast is a rich melange of oily fabulists and horse faced hacks. All zeroes, no heroes.

and Elke

MTF Tobin- Not me !
If Ted's not happy, I'm happy.

Re: "It is so very simple: Kasich could win the general; Cruz can not."

What evidence is this assumption based on? As Cruz appositely points out, Kasich can't even get any Republicans to vote for him. He certainly wouldn't get any Democratic votes in the general election. If Kasich somehow became the Republican nominee (which is virtually impossible), the media would actually publicize his record and that myth the he's a "moderate" would be immediately exposed for the fabrication it is which would rule out votes from independents. That leaves pretty much nobody at all supporting Kasich.
I would have a modicum of confidence that Mr. Kasich could win the general [election] if he could carry a state in the primary. Or even place second.
It is so very simple: Kasich could win the general; Cruz can not.
So the Canadian guy running for the U.S. presidency is mad that the Pennsylvania-born Ohio governor/competitor doesn't "bow out"? That's rich.

Throwing Ryan into the mix makes an already scary scenario even scarier. Never has a more unqualified slate of candidates been placed before the voters. When Kasich is the voice of reason and sanity, you've got a problem.
Agreed. Ryan is the one the want.
One problem is that the GOP just a few scant years ago voted AGAINST any brokered conventions, so if they go down the illegal path to a brokered convention they lose and lose large!  And are dead!

If there's a contested convention, it's Paul Ryan they want. It isn't likely that any of Trump, Cruz, or Kasich will win the general. Unfortunately for the rest of us, the three who are running are going to get more and more desperate. Lord help us, it's already unbearable to watch!

All the Republican candidates are horrible. It's like choosing between whether to contract Malaria, the Plague, or Swine Flu. All of them will make you very sick, and might very well lead to your demise.
Jim, It's hard to imagine the American public winning at the end of the Republican contest! What an embarrassing cast of characters.

Nice one with a few bumps. It took a while to remember that while SEEGER has a double-E, PEABO uses EA. Didn't get the theme until after the puzzle was done, but it is a good one.

Depending on your generation the WHITE joker could be Betty, Slappy, or Ron, who is part of the Blue Collar Comedy Tour.

Loved the Seeger video. "Simpler" times, but harder for people of our political bent.
Perhaps, perhaps not...but he is better than Cruz.

Kasich hasn't been attacked yet or deeply investigated for the entire country to see. Most people in the U.S. don't know his record on issues because he doesn't like talking about it. If he's the Republican nominee, many of the moderate Republicans who initially breathe a sigh of relief will discover what he's really about and reluctantly decide to vote for Clinton.

IS the Cruz campaign stupid or is the Cruz campaign stupid? Do they really believe that by criticizing Kasich he is going to be more willing to step out of the election??? Mind boggling how stupid Trump and Cruz are!
All of them?
